sen.j: 神日（じんにち、貞観 (日本)2年（860年）- 延喜16年11月27日 (旧暦)（916年12月29日））は、平安時代前期から後期にかけての真言宗の僧。
sen.e: Jinnichi (860-December 29, 916) was a priest of Shingon sect from the early to the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「延喜16年11月27日 (旧暦)」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦916年12月29日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Jinnichi (860-December 29, 916) was a priest of the Shingon sect from the early to late Heian Period.
Jinnichi (860-December 29, 916) was a priest of the Shingon sect from the early to late Heian Period.

sen.j: 白雲上綱とも称される。
sen.e: He was also called Hakuun Joko.
He was also called Hakuun Joko.
sen.cmt: Hakuun Joko にダブルクォーテーションを追加しました。

sen.j: 京都愛宕山の白雲寺で円成寺益信から灌頂を受け、玄証・延性から真言密教を学んだ。
sen.e: He received Kanjo (a consecration ceremony by pouring water onto the top of monk's head) by Yakushin of Enjo-ji Temple and learned the Shingon Esoteric Buddhism from Gensho, Ensho and so on.
Jinnichi received Kanjo (a consecration ceremony by pouring water onto the top of a monk's head) by Yakushin of the Enjo-ji Temple and learned Shingon Esoteric Buddhism from Gensho and Ensho.
sen.cmt: Changed "He" to "Jinnichi" here since this is the beginning of a paragraph; I don't see anything in the Japanese to correspond to "and so on" so I omitted it; fixed grammar
sen.e: Jinnichi received Kanjo (a consecration ceremony by pouring water onto the top of a monk's head) by Yakushin ENJOJI in Hakuun-ji Temple on Mt. Atago, Kyoto and learned Shingon Esoteric Buddhism from Gensho and Ensho.
sen.cmt: Yakushin of the Enjo-ji Temple をYakushin ENJOJI に修正しました。「京都愛宕山の白雲寺で」訳漏れin Hakuun-ji Temple on Mt. Atago, Kyoto を追記しました。

sen.j: 白雲寺の上綱をつとめ、916年（延喜16年）律師に任じられた。
sen.e: He served as Joko of Hakuun-ji Temple and in 916 was appointed Risshi (Buddhist priest).
He served as Joko of Hakuun-ji Temple and in 916 was appointed as Risshi (Buddhist priest).
He served as Joko of Hakuun-ji Temple and in 916 was appointed as Risshi (Buddhist priest).
